Message.Title: They remove some of these crackpot posts before one can respond...
Message.Msg: ... Ah, the extremists hiding behind their limited knowledge and interpretation of the Constitution once again, believing they somehow have the ultimate authority to be judge, jury and executioner. “Shame she didn't have one of those 10 bullet clips. She could have probably done a better job.” – frog “… he sure was ‘mean’ AND UGLY looking...but if she'd had good aim, or wanted too, perhaps there'd be no need for a trial (??)…Good job girl ...– jongunshowgeek (Hey, jon, if being ugly was a death sentence, you’d have served life in the electric chair long ago.) “One shot from the Judge with PDX ammo would have done the job…” – fake ricky “…we all need to have an equalizer.” – wilkes (isn’t that what the mass murderers say?) These people are nothing more than crackpot, tea party, extremist wackos who refuse to acknowledge that America’s repeated tragedies are unlike anywhere else in the world simply because of archaic gun control and mental health laws. And, not unlike their other politics, their only way of trying to get their way is through obfuscation of the issues. Nobody is trying to take all your guns away, kids. Sane regulation of an out-of-control arms industry is NOT a violation of your 2nd Amendment rights. You can still gather at your gun shows in your cammies and compare caliber, lethality and potency of your Freudian symbols of masculinity in a futile attempt to compensate for your own lack of self-esteem. What you CANNOT do is to attempt to transform a logical and long overdue discussion of these issues into some off-the-wall, lunatic government conspiracy theory which is out to disarm everyone, give them lobotomies and put everyone into detention camps. You people are really, really off-the-wall. And no one symbolizes what jon and all his aliases represent any better than Alex Jones did on Piers Morgan. This knuckle-dragging, frothing-at-the-mouth, red-neck ignoramus came completely unhinged like some finger-pointing, loud mouth drunken bully in a bar. These frightened little sick people, with Napoleon complexes who are unable to defend themselves otherwise (like most of the mass-murderers) are the LAST people we want to be walking around with automatic weapons.

Message.Msg: ... “According to the FBI, the #1 weapon used in violent crimes…is a baseball bat.” – pinhigh who thinks Tiger Wood’s wife should have used and AK-47 instead of that nine-iron. More bull from the gun lobby. Didn’t you learn from the last election that you do not, and will not, ever get your way by lying to people? Homicides by Weapon Type Year Handgun OtherGun Knife BluntObject OtherWeapon 1976 8651 3328 3343 912 2546 1980 10,552 3834 4439 1153 3061 1990 11677 3395 4077 1254 3037 2000 7985 2218 2099 727 2556 2005 8478 2868 2147 671 2528 I’m pretty sure a baseball bat would be considered a blunt object. So, you have three choices: Show us your sources. Admit you are lying. Bludgeon yourself into submission with a Louisville Slugger.

Topic.Title: why are telecoms down so much more than averages?

Message.Msg: +1 on that. Street upset if they don't sell enough of them, but when they sell as many as expected or surpass the predictions, they are punished by both the margins and the traders because of what will happen to the margins. The only benefit is that the loss on the Android smart's is not as high as on the Apple phones... maybe the Street is pricing too much Apple hit?

Topic.Title: Let's stat a compsny and make a lot of money

Message.Msg: It's coffee as I am wired up on this new idea. I was thinking on going to China to have them made in different sizes, they already know how, and I ain't gots no ideas how to make them, I have a lead with a Kmart store manager in Texas who says he will give up a shelf for them to see how they sell. Mainly I had a revelation when some guy says on TV guns don't kill people, after I watched pictures of little children's faces before they was shot 5-10 times each, so I thought oh boy that means nuclear bombs don't kill neither, as unless someone uses a nuclear bomb it just sits there doing nothing, so it's people, not nuclear bombs, that kill, I says to myself. I want to be the first one in on this new idea, as I know they will sell like hot cakes at Kmart and the shows.

Topic.Title: Let's stat a compsny and make a lot of money

Nation they say is not going to sell because of price, so start with these. Somehow I thought when the 2nd amendment was written. it meant you could bear a gun with a single shot ball and powder, but thanks to TV I now know there are no such limits to the word "arms."

Message.Title: Harry Reid the new hero of the right
Message.Msg: Again Nancy's prophetic words "you have to pass the bill to find out what's in it" have come back to haunt us. Recently gun advocates have found a little tidbit within the Obama care law. Senate Amendment 3276, Sec. 2716, part C. states: The government can not collect any information relating to the lawful ownership or possession of a firearm or amunition Again thank you Harry for all that you do "In your heart you know he is right" The Frogg

Topic.Title: They remove some of these crackpot posts before one can respond...

Message.Msg: Actually, echo, he may be on to something. According to Pin, the number 1 weapon used in *violent crimes* is baseball bats. In 2011, however, guns were the cause of death in 67.7% of all *homicides*. So what does this tell us? Despite quite a bit of effort on their part, people with baseball bats don't kill people. People with guns kill people.
